abstract: Markets were rattled after the chief executive of AT&T suggested a weaker economy was forcing consumers to scale back spending.
snippet: Markets were rattled after the chief executive of AT&T suggested a weaker economy was forcing consumers to scale back spending.
lead_paragraph: Stocks tumbled Tuesday afternoon after the chief executive of the nation’s largest phone company, AT&T, suggested a weaker economy was forcing consumers to scale back spending.

headline.main: Stocks Tumble on New Signs of Economic Woes
